00039 LinearInterpolator::LinearInterpolator()
00040 {
00041 }
00042 
00043 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00044 LinearInterpolator* LinearInterpolator::clone()
00045 {
00046     // create a copy of this
00047     LinearInterpolator* li = new LinearInterpolator(*this);
00048     // return it
00049     return li;
00050 }
00051 
00052 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00053 Iterator<m_value_type> LinearInterpolator::valueIterator()
00054 {
00055     // now, we create a LinearInterpolatorIterator with these entries:
00056     LinearInterpolatorIterator* lii = new LinearInterpolatorIterator();
00057 
00058     // special case for zero entries:
00059     if (size() == 0)
00060     {
00061         lii->append(0,0,0,0,long( getDuration() * getSamplingRate() ));
00062         return Iterator<m_value_type>(lii);
00063     }
00064 
00065     // we need to sort the values in this LinearInterpolator by time:
00066     sortCollection();
00067     
00068     // We are going to scale all of the values here by the duration.
00069     // so, the higest value in this collection will be mapped to Duration.
00070     // we do this by specifying a sampling rate for the conversion:
00071 
00072     m_time_type maxTime = get(size() - 1).time_;
00073     m_value_type mySamplingRate = (getDuration() / maxTime) * getSamplingRate();
00074 
00075     // an iterator for this collection:
00076     Iterator<InterpolatorEntry> it = iterator();
00077     
00078     // grab the first value:
00079     InterpolatorEntry lie = it.next();
00080     m_value_type lastValue = lie.value_;
00081     m_time_type lastTime = lie.time_;
00082     
00083     // special case for only one entry:
00084     if (size() == 1)
00085     {
00086         lii->append(lastTime,lastTime,lastValue,lastValue,long( getDuration() * getSamplingRate() ));
00087     }
00088 
00089     while (it.hasNext())
00090     {
00091         // get the next entry:
00092         lie = it.next();
00093         
00094         // convert this entry into a LinearInterpolatorIterator::Entry
00095         m_time_type timeDiff = lie.time_ - lastTime;
00096         m_sample_count_type steps = (m_sample_count_type) (timeDiff * mySamplingRate);
00097         // and add it to the iterator:
00098         lii->append(lastTime,lie.time_,lastValue, lie.value_, steps);
00099         
00100         // update values:
00101         lastValue = lie.value_;
00102         lastTime = lie.time_;
00103         
00104     }
00105     
00106     // wrap the abstract iterator as an iterator and return:
00107     return Iterator<m_value_type>(lii);
00108 }
00109     
00110 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00111 interpolation_type LinearInterpolator::getType()
00112 {
00113   return LINEAR;
00114 }

00131 Iterator<m_value_type> ExponentialInterpolator::valueIterator()
00132 {
00133     // now, we create a ExponentialInterpolatorIterator with these entries:
00134     ExponentialInterpolatorIterator* eii = new ExponentialInterpolatorIterator();
00135

00141     }
00142

00144     sortCollection();

00157     InterpolatorEntry eie = it.next();

00171

00175         // and add it to the iterator:

00177
